Homebrew/Backgrounds/Dustborn-Oracle.title: Dustborn Oracle
Homebrew/Backgrounds/Dustborn-Oracle.content:
You were born not of tribe or town, but of earth and air. The dust that rises where stone meets sky called you into existence ‚Äî a sign, a curse, or a blessing. The whisper of shifting sands and the soft caress of wind carry your name, and wherever you go, the ground feels steady beneath your feet even as the air moves freely around you.
From childhood, you have felt the grounding presence of earth mixed with the freedom of air within your soul ‚Äî a balance of stability and change. Drawn to the mysteries of the natural world, you have spent your life attuned to the harmony between the solid and the intangible, the steadfast and the fleeting. Your journey is one of balance, seeking to unite the freedom of the skies with the strength of the earth.
Skill Proficiencies
You gain proficiency in one of the following skills:

Nature
Survival
Perception
Insight
Stealth

These skills reflect your connection to the natural world, your awareness of the environment, and your ability to move unseen and understand hidden truths.

Languages
You can speak one additional language:

Primordial ‚Äî the voice of elemental chaos
Terran ‚Äî the language of earth elementals and stone spirits
Auran ‚Äî the tongue of air elementals and sky spirits


Equipment
You begin with:

Lightweight oracle robes, woven from fine linen and dust-colored fabrics that blend into the earth and sky
A small pouch of sacred dust and soil from a sacred place (your spellcasting focus)
A carved stone pendant, smooth and cool to the touch
A simple wooden staff, worn but strong


Feature: Dustbound Familiar
You have a familiar spirit born of earth and air ‚Äî an elemental echo of your soul that embodies both weight and lightness. It might take the form of a tiny dust devil, a small stone hawk, a feathered lizard, or a swirling mote of sand.
Rules:

It is an Elemental, not a Beast.
It can take reflavored forms of the standard familiar options (owl, cat, raven, etc.).
It can deliver touch-range spells as usual but cannot take any other combat-related actions.
When reduced to 0 hit points, you immediately take damage equal to your character level (no saving throw or resistance applies).
It cannot be magically resummoned immediately but returns to you after a long rest or a short rest taken in a dry, open natural environment such as deserts, canyons, or high plateaus.
Each time it returns, you may choose a new form.
This bond is unique and subject to DM approval.

Gust

1st Level

Fog Cloud
Thunderwave

2nd Level

Dust Devil (custom or reflavored Gust of Wind)

3rd Level

Wind Wall
Erupting Earth (Elemental Evil Player‚Äôs Companion)
Sleet Storm

4th Level

Rules: All spells require DM approval and are available only if you have the Spellcasting feature.
Whenever you cast a spell not granted by your Dustborn Magic feature and that deals damage other than earth or air damage, subtract your proficiency bonus from the spell‚Äôs attack roll or saving throw DC (as appropriate).

Theme
As a Dustborn Oracle, you embody the paradox of lightness and weight ‚Äî the steady strength of earth combined with the freedom and unpredictability of air. You walk a path between stability and change, grounding those around you while embracing the winds of transformation.

Use this background to inspire character traits, bonds, ideals, and flaws that reflect a soul shaped by dust and wind.‚Äù

Homebrew/Backgrounds/Mudborn-Oracle.title: Mudborn Oracle

Since childhood, you have felt the steady power of the earth within your soul ‚Äî a force that both nourishes and challenges you. Driven by the mysteries of the elements, you have spent your life listening to the quiet call of the soil and the rushing flow of waters. Your path is one of patience, growth, and the search for balance between stability and change.
Skill Proficiencies

Nature
Survival
Medicine
Insight

Homebrew/Backgrounds/Stormborn-Oracle.content:

Wherever you go, the air seems charged with electric anticipation, and the distant rumble of thunder echoes your heartbeat.
From childhood, you felt the restless energy of storms within your soul ‚Äî a force that both guides and unsettles you. Drawn to the mysteries of the elements, you spent your life listening to the whispers of the wind and the roaring calls of the sea. Your journey is one of discovery, seeking balance between the chaos of the storm and the calm at its eye

Insight
Perception
Arcana
Religion
Performance

These reflect your intuition, attunement to mystical forces, and your elemental awareness, as well as your ability to charm people by entrancing them through song and dance.

Languages
You can speak one additional language:

Primordial ‚Äî the voice of elemental chaos
Celestial ‚Äî the language of divine spirits
Sylvan ‚Äî the tongue of nature and the fey


Equipment

Lightweight oracle robes, woven from airy fabrics that shimmer like storm clouds
A stormglass orb (your spellcasting focus)
A phial of everflowing water, sacred and eternal

Feature: Stormbound Familiar

Instead, it returns to you after a long rest, or after a short rest only if you rest during natural rainfall, thunderstorms, or near wild bodies of water (magically created rain or storms do not count). Homebrew/Feats/Arcane-Vessel.title: Arcane Vessel
Homebrew/Feats/Arcane-Vessel.content:
DnDBeyond
You are a living embodiment of magic. Arcane energies protect you, when your focus falters, they sometimes bridge the gap to keep your spell flowing.


Mage Armor (1/long rest):
You can cast Mage Armor on yourself once per long rest without expending a spell slot or requiring material components.


Constitution Save Boost (1/short rest):
Once per long rest, when you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you choose to make that roll with Advantage.

Rolle in der Welt

Ihre Anwesenheit k√ºndigt bedeutende Ver√§nderungen an, und manche Kulturen verehren sie als direkte Verbindung zu den Elementarg√∂ttern. Gleichzeitig bergen sie immer das Potenzial, als unkontrollierbare Kr√§fte aufzutreten, deren Einfluss sowohl segensreich als auch zerst√∂rerisch sein kann.
Spielmechanische Aspekte & Charakterfreiheit
Orakel manifestieren sich meist als Genasi, da diese Rasse eng mit den Elementen verbunden ist. Jedoch k√∂nnen auch andere Rassen unter besonderen Umst√§nden als Orakel geboren werden, zum Beispiel, wenn sie w√§hrend starker elementarer Ereignisse oder g√∂ttlicher Manifestationen das Licht der Welt erblicken.
W√§hrend Kleriker, Zauberer, Druiden und M√∂nche die h√§ufigsten Klassen f√ºr Orakel sind, steht es den Spielern frei, andere Klassen zu w√§hlen. Ein Orakel kann jede Klasse verk√∂rpern, solange die Verbindung zu den Elementen in der Hintergrundgeschichte und Pers√∂nlichkeit verankert ist.

Das Ziel ist, die Vielfalt und Einzigartigkeit der Orakel zu feiern und sie zu facettenreichen Charakteren zu machen, die sowohl mechanisch als auch erz√§hlerisch funktionieren.

Diese Informationen helfen Spielern und Spielleitern dabei, die Orakel flexibel und vielf√§ltig in ihre Kampagnen einzubauen.
